website_summaries.verdict: Many neutral runners were very happy with the Under Armour HOVR Phantom Connected. They loved its comfortable underfoot platform, the modern design, and the sock-like fit. On the other hand, some purchasers were disappointed with their wear experience. Still, this running companion gained praise for being a solid performer on the road.
pros: Many people felt that the underfoot cushioning system of the Under Armour HOVR Phantom Connected offered comfort and energetic
The color schemes were welcomed by runners who wanted a contemporary design for their footwear
Several testers welcomed the traction capability of the outsole unit
According to some consumers who had tendon or muscle problems, the midsole warded off any onset of foot discomfort
The weight of this shoe was deemed sufficiently light
Based on a couple of reviews, the façade was able to give a secure and sock-like fit
Shoe enthusiasts welcomed the fact that this shoe can be used as a fashion accessory
cons: The stretchable ankle collar is uncomfortable according to some wearers
The upper wasn’t as supportive as expected, a tester observed
Apparently, the foot tended to slide towards the front of the shoe

customer_reviews.title: Great support and comfort even for the biggest MOOSE!
customer_reviews.text: My MOOSE of an ex-Oregon Duck football playing husband with large-wide feet is feeling pretty good in these. Bought for a trip to DC & NY where we were on our feet over 20,000 steps a day! He has foot issues, always sore & hurting. These shoes gave him great support and he felt good!
customer_reviews.author: Pure Hearted Foodie

customer_reviews.title: They Cool for the Health Club
customer_reviews.text: I just splurged on these because I saw the UA advertising plastered all over the walls at the downtown store in Chicago. Even the sales associate couldn't explain the digital technology. I didn't buy them to run in anyway just for a casual style with jeans and jogging suits. There comfortable and I recommend but not the price tag. Also go a 1/2 size large
customer_reviews.author: James Lofton

customer_reviews.title: A nightmare to put on... but,
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair about a month ago. They look great. The technology feature is pretty kool, but, I don't run (metal knees). I wish I'd purchased a size larger, but, these fit (barely). The worst part is trying to put them on. It's really tricky... like trying to mold them to your feet every single tiiiiime. I'm hoping the elastic portion at the ankle will give some and become more comfortable. I pretty much have to wear them without socks, or with very, very thin socks... otherwise, it would be nearly impossible to put them on. The shoes fit and feel nice, though. Time will tell. Oy! : )
customer_reviews.author: Tonester & Echo

customer_reviews.title: UH is always good
customer_reviews.text: Very good shoe, but I miss I knew the inteesole did not come out
customer_reviews.author: David and Camile Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the feel of these shoes they were too small ...
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the feel of these shoes they were too small as my toes rubbed the ends and i had to return them. They are hard to find in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised and no support from Under Armour
customer_reviews.text: These shoes with so called technology is the worst product Under Armour has ever come up with. The sensor DOES NOT work at all. And the support from Under Armour is just as bad. I have reached out and do not get any resolution. I wish I could return them and get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: tritc20

customer_reviews.title: All around great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Really light and nice cushion. Pairing to the app was pretty straight forward. I've had them about a month now and so far they are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Van Kampen

customer_reviews.title: Blisters
customer_reviews.text: The sock part around the ankle gives my 13 yo blisters at the back of his heel.
customer_reviews.author: Jedo

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable.. Note.. UA shoes have always run a halve to a full size smaller for me. Adjust your order to your fit.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe. Super light and feels great during long runs.
customer_reviews.author: T.David

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these he is on his feet for his job for 12 hours a night
customer_reviews.author: amy clancy

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Runs a bit small. For casual use buy a 1/2 size bigger. For actual long running, buy a full size.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Parrilla

customer_reviews.title: Built in socks
customer_reviews.text: It’s like wearing built in socks that are a tad too high around the ankles. They rub my ankles a little and tend to make raw marks. I like wearing no-show socks, but in these shoes, it hurts to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Yaeger

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable and highly recommend for those who have flat feet. Just ordered my third pair the other day.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but not for narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: Not comfortable. Rubbed on ankle weird. Too tight on top. Way too narrow. First pair of under armour shoes that I dislike.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Shillington

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Well Underarmour shoes are slightly small. As long as you know that, you will be able to get a perfect pair. This sneaker is great for running. Very supportive sole and lightweight and solid all over. Great construction and clean athletic look.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit & Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These sharp looking phantom ct running shoes are very comfortable for walking, riding, jogging or any active sport you like. The fit is good, and they are a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Perfect Moment

customer_reviews.title: Really nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: Like the way this shoe fits. Very comfortable. Really cool style as well. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Nichols

product_meta.title: Under Armour Men's HOVR Phantom Connected Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Point blank: you’ve never felt a shoe like this before. It’s literally like wrapping your foot in a pillow—but one that’s so super-light that you forget it’s there. It’s comfort that comes from the anatomically designed, molded interior, the super-plush knit collar, and the layers of plush material that envelop your foot. Simply put, the second you step into the UA HOVR Phantom, you'll know why we call it a whole new running experience. Knit ankle collar provides a snug, bootie-like fit. External heel counter creates the ultimate in stable support. Ultra-breathable, SpeedForm 2.0 sockliner is built with gender specific contours for extra protection & softer underfoot support. Full rubber outsole features unique knobbed texture for elevated traction & durability . Offset: 8mm. Weight: 10.20oz/293g.
feature_bullets: DIGITALLY CONNECTED: UA’s Record Sensor technology tracks, analyzes & stores virtually every running metric so you know exactly what you need to do to get better
UA HOVR technology provides ‘zero gravity feel’ to maintain energy return that helps eliminate impact step after step
Compression mesh Energy Web contains & molds UA HOVR foam to give back the energy you put in
Microthread upper dries fast & provides a breathable, compression-like fit that delivers lightweight directional strength & unmatched comfort
3D molded midfoot panel with laser perforations for increased ventilation
